review_text: Similar to most interactive storytelling games, 11-11 Memories Retold is not for everyone, and the bold artistic style of the game may be a negative factor for some. But for players looking for a character-driven meditative experience, the game offers a brief, family-oriented, and somewhat flawed look at wars away from the sounds of high explosions we see in other games, and instead presents a humane story about the impact of wars on the people and people around them.
The story here is everything. The story wasn't mythical, but it wasn't bad either. And finally, it can be said that it's not boring, and that's enough.

The number of characters means that there are some slow scenes and re-enactments, and without burning anything from the story some elements of the story and the contact was unsuccessful in my opinion. The combat system is presented abstractly like Google Maps, and makes the distinction between enemies and characters sometimes less clear than expected as well as there is fluctuation in enemies in some fights that are delayed when there are many enemies.

The game is a comic book game in which you move between 13 characters, as well as there is tactical combat and a page to review scenes and open files that give you a better idea of the story and characters. What is unique about the game is that you can move between the stories of any of the characters and the free-fight within certain boundaries, making the presentation of the story closer to the gradual completion of the picture rather than a purely linear story and adds much to the experience. The story is the biggest element of the game, there are 13 characters that intersect their stories, and the story is ambitious not only in terms of the number of characters but also in terms of the time frames that it covers, and it is presented to a world of users who are familiar with the 1980s animation and animation, and the game's evolution and evolution of the characters.

The overall gameplay may not be bad, but it's very organized, and it's pretty much the same throughout the game. The game relies entirely on sneaking, but the gameplay methods adopted are very rudimentary, distract the enemy who walks the same path over and over again by throwing stones or other pieces to escape, yes, the game begins to give the player more tools as he progresses through the game, but the artificial intelligence of performance and repetition makes the same gameplay less challenging.

The game's storyline is powerful and influential despite the fact that there are some problems with the character of Amesia that makes you attached to it, the skill tree system is very realistic, the mouse design is really scary, the numbers are huge, the music is enjoyable and the sound is spectacular.

The design of the stages is boring and the game is challenging in its essence, the artificial intelligence of the soldiers is too low, there are major performance problems, and the number of game chapters is too long.

In a nutshell, buy this game if you like chaotic and crazy arcade racing and are looking for something different than usual, with excellent graphic quality and greatness, but otherwise there is nothing that the player who loves realistic driving or the great sounds of cars desires, and we never advise you to buy it now before deadly technical problems are fixed.

Ragnarok represents a quality transfer in individual adventure games, outperforming its predecessor in all aspects, concluding Crete's journey through Scandinavian lands epically from the first to the last moment without leaving any chance to catch breath, offering a much deeper story than just a fiery war between the gods, contributing to the development of gameplay mechanisms, narrative method and customization options, providing greater variety in battles with high-quality sub-content that spans tens of hours, as well as clearly overcoming the main problems of the last part consisting of limited enemy diversity and slower narrative speed, making it one of the best-selling PlayStation shares throughout history, making it the best.

Even with flaws in reaction speed, the flexibility and speed of the player's motion are smooth, and the camera-time combat method of delivering strikes to monsters and enemies offers a distinctive form in the form of a film clip, which is actually part of your movements and combat skills while playing.While the enemy's artificial intelligence is limited and does not interact with the player's actions, fighting heads is fun and requires you to plan and schedule the attack and defense and use most of the skills to skip the battle smoothly making most of the tasks somewhat enjoyable, being the only positive aspect of repeated tasks.

The game has a lot of technical problems, especially some areas of the game have a clear tire problem, and I also noticed a delay in the reaction and it repeats itself several times in different locations, which happens when I press a control button or mouse button, the character does not meet the demand until after a slight but annoying delay, ruining your gaming experience depending on the fast action and timing of the game.

This game offers golf enthusiasts an unusual, refreshing experience through a form of platform adventure in which you move from stage to stage to overcome challenges and get to the destination, and the game has a fun short story when it comes to its conclusion and a uniform design for all stages, which may reduce the quality of the game, but generally you have good fun for $10 if you like golf and combine this sport with renewed challenges.

The design of the city is so elaborate that you'll find yourself familiar with taking a snapshot from one moment to the next. The variety of characters in each character has its own distinct path and combat mode and vehicle dedicated to exploring the world. The idea of the story is interesting and a new idea, I've already imagined Gotham City without Batman despite the slow pace of the story. The variety of costumes in each character has a considerable number of outfits that add to you features that differ from other fashion features. The variety of skills and differences between characters such as the character Batgirl can disable security devices while the character Redhood is characterized by its use of handguns.

Gotham Knights reintroduces the city of Gotham in a distinctive overall design and provides fun to explore and navigate both on top of the data boards or using a Batman bike, with a story that keeps you excited thanks to the ambiguity surrounding it, and the ability to switch between 4 seamen despite a lack of diversity, on the other hand, the game clearly suffered in the design of stages and enemies and the pattern of repetition of its side activities, and the tree provided limited skill improvements that didn't make you feel the needed change, and neglected the hide-and-seek technique in a provocative way, which may have made you interested at the beginning of its events, but after a period of time you will find yourself stuck in an endless circle.

The game's performance on current-generation devices is considered to be worse than I've seen, the game runs at 30 frames per second and can sometimes drop to 25 despite the need to stabilize the frames in a game like this. There are repetitions in the fighting system despite the variety of skills, but you won't need most of them, and your way to win is to simply press a square button and avoid them. Sometimes you may need to use some skills that hit more than one enemy but weren't enough to save the fighting system for me.

I would like the package to include a history of each game's development, either an explanation or an encounter, especially the similar parts in their labels and the different parts in their content, as well as the entirely new part.

There are 7 separate games and a total of 18 different versions including different versions (more or less) in different geographies and even improved versions of the same game. Playing them in the same order illustrates the evolution of the series as if you were traveling through its different history. Games in their design and quality, the Gradius/Nemesis series presented a high challenge and mechanics such as determining the evolution of your aircraft while the Salamander series introduced biological enemies instead of robots and a game that combines horizontal and horizontal.

When it comes to the finest details of auto racing, Gran Turismo 7's impressively detailed contribution in that part with a realistic and accurate gameplay of the highest degree, excellent physics of car movement just as it happens at the highest levels of competition, designs that are difficult to distinguish from reality for either cars or racetracks, a graphic level that exceeds expectations, a wealth of details that record the history of major manufacturers and the most prominent cars over the course of history, as well as the title welcomes both new and veteran players with great simplicity and simplicity, which is reflected passively later in the interaction between the various characters and structures, and the mechanical features of the game, as well as the ability to replicate and replicate the rules and regulations of the car.

Car games are very suitable for virtual reality, especially if you are using a steering wheel but even with the normal hand, since whether you are sitting in the game and in reality. you will feel that you are actually driving a fast car and you will notice more details than on TV, such as competing cars when they come close to you and the details of the cabin such as navigation and interior decoration. races become more enthusiastic and circuits seem larger and competitors are more dangerous with virtual reality and even your appreciation of the curves becomes more accurate because of your three-dimensional view of them (a different image of each foot).

The game's performance is 60 frames as normal rotation turns to 120 frames (because the helmet supports frequencies 90 and 120) which means you may sometimes see a double image, as well as the accuracy and some effects of lower quality due to higher virtual reality requirements.

The stunning graphics mode, which is the same as the graphics of the Dragon Ball Fighterz and Guilty Gear Strive games but with better quality, character details, costume animation, and physics outperform everything the studio has done and the most noticeable differences here are character features that differ between each character and each other, which distinguishes all the characters, effects, and new colors, adding to the game's spirit without disturbing your way through the gameplay, which is rare in modern fighting games and is often combined with exaggerated effects as the story unfolds, but the funniest part here is the presence of exaggerated characters such as the game's characters, the game's characters, the game's characters, the game's characters, and the game's characters, which can be played from person to person, and which is one of the rarest in modern fighting games so that you can combine the storylines and the game's storylines in a way that makes the game's storytelling and gameplay more complex than the game's predecessors.

Playing online with an opponent outside of your logic and not at the level of other fighting games of this generation, faced with the difficulties of playing against Europeans of slow play such as delay in answering buttons or cutting the game has no depth in the system of combos to the point of being boring for fighting game players who are looking for their own innovative way of playing and distinguish themselves from others.

The large number of characters that each character differs from the other in their way of playing, functioning, and presentation during confrontations, and your change in personality means not only the difference in weaponry and type of movements, but also some of its exclusive mechanisms such as the Narmaya character, which is very similar to the Vergil character from the game Devil May Cry or the Siegfried character, gives you the feeling of controlling the Cloud character from the remake of Final Fantasy VII.

The lack of presence of the side characters in the story, their role is very superficial and has no effect on them except some conversations and film footage, and the shortness of the story was the reason there wasn't enough time to refine most of the characters and their stories. Your inability to play the story online despite the game's focus on the collaborative gameplay element.

The developer creates in animated fighting games such as Dragonball FighterZ and Guilty Gear Xrd, and this game is the best thing produced so far, with the character design of the painter Minaba who designed characters from parts of the Final Fantasy series such as the fifth and ninth, and here are the character designs with the graphics engine that gives it an animated look that makes it a very beautiful and artistic game, especially when the camera is nearing the beginning of the fight and when the super-moves are being executed, and with some of the beautiful music that was created by the main composer of the Final Fantasy series like Final Fantasy Uematsu.

12 characters for the new game isn't a bad number of bits, but for those who care about the size of the content it's less than other fighting games, and there's an additional paid character that came down with the game's release outside of Japan plus 3 more within the first season (a total of 16 characters, which is equal to the number of Street Fighter V characters when it came out 4 years ago).

game_name: Grand Theft Auto: The Trilogy - The Definitive Edition
review_text: It's no secret that the three GTA games released at the beginning of the last millennium are like gems or priceless diamonds, but instead of taking those gems out of the underworld and presenting them in a decent way to their loved ones more than 17 years later, Rockstar discovered dust and presented them in a lazy and humiliating way, neither received their old compliments, nor welcomed new players sufficiently.

Gravel is focused on offering road racing and racing in a distinctive style, and the studio has already succeeded in offering a fun and enjoyable game within the race, but it has offered a very low fee level and the game does not contain many cars and circuits, which may make you prefer other games.
Most puzzles are easy and you won't find any real challenge, and if you do, it's probably because of control.

The puzzles are simple and you get powers like the ability to turn planets into water, fire, snow, or green with your hair, and your goal at each stage of the stages above the 100 available is to get a star and exit the door. From the name of the game we learn that controlling gravity is the foundation of the game, there are small planets that attract you and others that push you and you need to move through them to get the star.

Voice acting is characterized by a high level of quality in most conversations, whether it is in the main story or the sub-tasks. the writing of the scripts and the quality of the main story events are exciting and make you craving and eager to learn more about the world and about the differences and conflicts between peoples, the characters always express themselves beautifully through the dialogue, the characters always link their dialogue with their religion or place of origin, and this leaves a very wonderful impression that it creates real events even if the world is imaginary. you can finish most of the basic and side-tasks in multiple ways and methods depending on how you play and on your choices in developing your personality, it is possible for the fighter to take advantage of these developments if it is possible for you to choose from the characters or the place of origin, and you can also focus on each person.

The aesthetics of the graphics are not at the desired level, leaving the impression that it is a game of the past generation, the shapes of buildings and areas, and the artistic orientation of how the characters are designed were all somewhat acceptable, but left me unhappy. The player's action during the fight is fast and strange, some of them do not express the power of the strike or the skill that was used, and some give a full idea of the power of this skill or the strike, unfortunately the process of moving characters by the developer was mostly unsuccessful.

The difficulty you may have is timing your jumps and the distance between the obstacles and determining which obstacles you can use and even if you fail there are no consequences, you won't die and you won't return to the beginning of the stage. Some areas have a slow characteristic where you can't run and the road may be long and there's nothing to interact with but it's kind of part of the story experience.

The graphics feature similar watercolor backgrounds that reflect the game's atmosphere, and see bright colors that vary depending on the region and the circumstances the character is experiencing. The mysteries and environments are diverse and vivid, with their finest details breathing in and interacting with you, from leaves of trees, stone and dust, waterfalls and waterfalls, snow and frozen surfaces and even blankets and strange creatures.

The game is divided into interconnected areas and each area is open, but moving from region to region is largely linear and the story moves, as well as the forces that open up new areas you get in specific locations, which limits the game's freedom slightly, and puzzles and challenging platforms dominate the game, and the latter part of the game is much more so that the game is sort of ranked so that its length seems longer than it is.

The game has a Mexican character in its world and your character is a Mexican wrestler and in the superstitions inspired by Mexican civilization that we find in the forces and enemies, but the light comedy character also includes the ability to destroy rocks of red, blue, and yellow blocks your way and to cling to flying objects and use them to reach high places. The game has a Mexican character in its world and your character is a Mexican wrestler and in the superstitions inspired by Mexican civilization that we find in the forces and enemies, but in the light comedy character also includes the ability to destroy rocks from other games, and in the superstitious world of flying objects and to use them to reach high places.

The puzzles and exploration are simple and the fighting becomes orderly over time (especially the usual enemies), and development doesn't change much in this. Fewer than 15 characters, especially since only two of them are new, and also because it has been announced that additional paid content featuring 5 characters will be available to the first character (which is new to the series) within a month of the game's release.

The new part of the old series retains in many respects the roots of the series, but is not afraid to offer new touches to provide a fun experience with an online platform with innovative and distinctive design and many other gameplay elements with customization options and player motivation towards more play to buy cosmetic accessories in virtual currency, where we saw a few flaws mostly in the balance of combat, the speed of character response and the flexibility of their movement.

The development team took advantage of this point in an innovative way, giving players an incentive to try again, perhaps only to uncover the secrets of the story.

Actually, this is not a big problem, but in some rooms in the early stages, enemies trick you into seeing them, causing a sudden congestion. In some rooms, fighting was chaotic, especially with so many enemies, oh my god if there was a leader too! in fact, sometimes I didn't know where to hit from so many enemies.

The story is told only when your story dies, and every time you return to the house or base the pieces and aspects of the story are adapted through you with the characters who meet them on the move.
Some technical problems that can be solved with future updates.

The best story since Halo 3 The idea of the open world in Halo games is to add a distinctive diversity in the uses of the mythical artificial intelligence device that will pose great difficulties for you, scenic graphics and have been greatly improved over the previous one.

The main enemies of the story did not get enough exposure to highlight their motives and goals. There is a repetition in the stage designs in the linear tasks of the story. The open areas of the story lack better employment and exploitation such as exploration.

After the spectacular performance of Halo 5: Guardians and the disappointment felt by fans of the series at the time, Studio 343 Industries is able to return to Bremontada "in a football style" strong and exciting through Halo Infinite. Starting with the game's distinctive story and powerful conversations, offering a different version of Master Chief that shows him how much of an emotional impact Cortana's absence had on him, and going through the game's open and offline world at the same time, which allows you to play for hours without feeling bored unlike other open world games.

The side of the game's protagonist Master Chief's relationship with the artificial intelligence character The Weapon and linking that side to previous events in the series. gave open areas a space of freedom in a welcoming gameplay style and closer to a series like Far Cry  but with the physical and artificial intelligence presence of the usual and distinctive opponents of the series.

There are no noticeable improvements to the graphics, most of the time the pre-produced scenes have been ported as they are (Pre-rendered Cutscenses) without adding any effects that match the quality of the current games. There are few options for modifying the graphics, and there is no option for Motion Blur to add or modify it, and there is no option to remove Film Grain (a light touch layer on the screen). Also, the pre-produced scenes have been ported as they are (Pre-rendered Cutscenses) developed as they are from previous versions, of low quality and at a rate of 30 frames per second. Heavy Detroit also noted that the downloading screens take about 15-20 seconds to complete, although the game's SSD features are available and the game's gameplay takes less time.

Attention to detail in general, such as playing from more than one perspective to know what is going on, being able to lose things around you and use them regardless of their importance, washing your hands before working if they become cloudy, having several options when performing an operation that may not match the outcome, and making some simple decisions that may affect a new ending.

review_text: The new game takes the principle of running games non-stop and adds to it the idea of clicking the buttons at the right time in conjunction with the music, if you like this idea, you will enjoy the dozens of stages that exist, but most likely you will be bothered by the repetition of the artwork, the design of the stages and some mistakes that need to be corrected.

The lack of a Lock On feature to enable the player to identify the target he wants to hit in confrontations, making some confrontations a little chaotic.
Designing some puzzles and platforming weren't the best thing.

A fascinating story with mythical characters, an addictive style of play, great artistic direction, beautiful paintings, visual music that keeps you enthusiastic throughout the experience, excellent technical performance from among the finest tapestries Bethesda has provided us.

Not only was HIFI Rush a surprise in terms of launch, but we can also consider it the perfect and integrated game in fast-paced games, the only downside of the game being the absence of puzzles that could have given the game a complete mark.

The Hitman Intro Pack didn't impress me much, but the story ends at an exciting moment to leave players eager to see what's next. The Hitman series has always been fun, but I'm frankly not convinced that the game will be released in separate installments.

A fantastic mission in a beautiful location with a variety of opportunities and a constantly increasing level of difficulty, the second Hitman mission is what any player in the 47 client titles is looking for in case we forget the citizen of the drawback and tire rate problems.

It's Hitman's newest mission, which comes under the title Colorado, as a replacement for the sleek traditional missions we've seen before, but the new formula doesn't quite fit the client 47.

The sixth episode of HITMAN ended the first season in a decent way and with an exciting mission unlike what the game offered in the last episodes, starting with a well-detailed map and having a secret target surrounded by all means of security and reaching new challenges, making it one of the best episodes of the game to date.

The game races to kill 5 random targets with another player across the network. The game is tolerant in terms of opening all the doors and offering several boxes of useful tools and costumes but balanced by the punitive system, so if you are exposed and hitting the target you will not be credited with the point as you are credited with killing the civilians. The game increases the game's life span and adds a social dimension to it. In particular, Sniper Assassin's, which is not restricted to the location, cannot move the player to a new location, but can move the player to a new location with the help of the punitive system.

The edges of the collaborative and competitive network Ghost and Sniper Assassin are enjoyable, but the matchmaking system is still being tested despite the fact that they released Sniper Assassin for play some time before its release. Also, the players are limited to just one location in Miami and Austria, and after playing them 4-6 times you will notice the repetition of goal positions and the situation becomes boring.

HITMAN 2 perfectly developed the advantages of the previous installment, with varied gameplay options, exciting scenarios to get rid of goals, carefully crafted massive stages, added to the collectible game Ghost, but at the same time suffered from recurring problems of the first installment beginning with the weak story and low level of artificial intelligence and arrival for the short time of the events, and although the real fun of the game is to repeat its stages and explore all the secrets, it cannot be overlooked that the story can be completed in less than 10 hours.

Even though the overall gameplay hasn't changed since its inception, working on the development of the main characters and the relationship between them throughout the game has helped to add depth to the story. Replacing the movie clips in the previous part with full action clips has helped to improve the plot and create a greater connection with the game's characters and events. Although the overall gameplay hasn't changed from the previous part, various new elements have been introduced to the task of adding a new sense of experience to the game, such as the ability to investigate the game's objectives and the ability to execute the game's objectives in a wide variety of ways, but there are many ways in which the game can be executed, and the ability to execute the game's objectives, as well as the ability to execute the game's objectives, and the ability to do so in a variety of ways.

Artificial intelligence sometimes fails, as it can kill your target in the middle of a crowded space or among its guards, and the guards will only search for a few minutes and then stop and nothing has happened.

The third part concludes in a satisfactory manner the events of this distinctive trilogy in Hitman's long career and makes it acceptable to adopt it whether you are an old player and have passed on the previous two parts or you want to experience the entire trilogy together through the third part alone, a lot of the greatness we see in the map design and the wide freedom in the way of finishing goals and the performance of the game is excellent on the current and old generation of home platforms but unfortunately there remain some flaws arising from the developer's omission of small details that should have been the natural evolution of the series or at least not good to abandon and some of which already exist in the titles of the old series.
The diversity of enemies is modest.

Some of the basic missions provided very good ideas for puzzles and wonderful special moments.The side missions listed under the category "Relationships" included very beautiful side stories, especially the story of Sebastian Sallow.Exploring the game world and interacting with the side content are simple ideas, but using magical abilities that are unlocked over time is also very enjoyable.

The game's story is deeper and full of epic details and philosophical personality Hornet is very carefully drawn and written in a brilliant way.The intense fighting style makes you feel like you're dancing with enemies.
The secret terminal needs some side-tasks, some of which can be boring.

The difficulty of the game can sometimes come unbalanced, even exaggerated. Some ordinary monsters incur unreasonable damage by taking two life clicks (masks) in one hit. Storage points are rare, especially in the first half of the game, and some require Rosary Beads which are not easy to obtain. This is one of the designs that makes you feel as if the team wanted to add difficulty to the cost of pleasure.

The world in the game is considered superb, and I've never seen anything like it in any Metroidvania game, so in every corner you'll discover details that tell you the story of the world and its mysteries or unplayable characters telling you the details of their tragedies in Phalroom.The action of the Hornet character outweighs the control of any Metroidvania character she's played over a period of time, and thanks to adventures such as climbing walls and moving she has that make every movement and ability visually stunning and enjoyable to control.The variety of boss battles is truly impressive, it's undoubtedly better and creates boss battles with the leaders she's played with in any game.

Like the rest of the graphics series, it's a beautiful blend of scenic nature and animal-like machines, and there's quite a diversity and details of several waterfalls, summits, and other highlights. This game is considered to be one of the games that you resort to when looking for a simple change, a fun style of play and a price that does not exceed $10 but at the same time suffers from a repetition that is perhaps inevitable.

A fun gameplay style that combines fighting and building with the support of cooperative gameplay, innovative maps full of details and diverse objectives, extensive character and weaponry allocation without the need to purchase simple and fun PvP elements that add variety to the game.

The repetition of the style of play can lead to boredom in the long run. The automatic shooting system can be uncomfortable for some players. Control settings and lists can be confusing and complicated.

Playing becomes orderly over time, especially the side-tasks of collecting material and developing your character, and even many of the key tasks and design of the unusual stages don't help, and the fighting system doesn't vary enough between the characters.

Like the previous installment and Persona Strikers, the game uses graphics and the game world on which it is based, and even combines the gameplay with that gameplay, there are underground areas with targets such as the Zelda dungeon, there are boss battles, there are flying fights, even Zonai weapons, etc. The story also highlights and adds elements from the Tears of the Kingdom universe. An experience free of technical problems and beautiful from start to finish with a simple story accompanied all the time by funny comments, true diversity of tasks and fantastic puzzles that invite creative thinking, would often be better off without a bad climbing mechanism and repetitive environments with sometimes blurry graphics and some other flaws.

game_name: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
review_text: The fantastic set of puzzles is even better compared to the original game, with excellent sound performance with great writing and a design that is unique to the region of Rome.

game_name: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
review_text: From the very first moments of the game, I felt that I knew this world and this character, who was able to be humorous with his expressions and comments even in the shortest moments, and his strained relationships with those around her. And even if you were not a fan of the movies, the world of the game and her character would be enchanted by a fun and entertaining story.

game_name: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
review_text: The AI in the game isn't the best, and it doesn't make you feel very challenged, enemies sometimes behave strangely. It may kill one enemy next to another without paying attention, or it may disappear a little when it's revealed and then it comes back as if nothing had happened. There is the ability to get you up again after death; it may kill you, then you stand up in front of it and it doesn't see you directly. For example, the character who walks with you may sometimes invade the enemy's place and sometimes start a fight with them, revealing you, and sometimes standing in front of you and blocking your way. Hand fighting in the game isn't the best idea.

game_name: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
review_text: The price is higher than that offered by the narrative expansion of the unstable and weightless expansion, there are no renovations or improvements to the gameplay.

game_name: Infinity Strash: Dragon Quest The Adventure of Dai
review_text: The repetition in the game may be the most in any RPG action game before and played, so the whole game is a fight, then a movie shot, then go to the map to select the next task and repeat the same steps, and all combat zones are circular enclosures and sometimes a small corridor crossing it to get to another circular enclosure. The combat system is characterized by nothing, and the regular strikes and avoidance respond very poorly, especially for this type of game that requires a quick reaction.

game_name: Infinity Strash: Dragon Quest The Adventure of Dai
review_text: The game is full of nostalgic moments and beautiful memories that we had with the anime, some of which were footage taken from the anime remake Brave Day Day released last year and some of which were recreated as movie footage from the game engine. They serve fans well in this aspect. Some fun spells are the only aspect of the exciting fighting system that made me more interested in witches, which is why I focus on Mazzy's personality because of the mixture of magic and magic.

The plot is excellent and superior to most other fighting games, whether the story itself is traditional and involves the alliance of allies and enemies to face the greater evil. The cinematic scenes are generally of good quality, especially the facial expressions in the cinematic scenes. As a fighting action game, the series is 60 frames per second. As a long and entertaining story, with a variety of conversations generally good and sometimes funny even if the story itself is traditional and it is an alliance of allies and enemies to face the greater evil. The cinematic scenes are generally of good quality, especially the facial expressions in the cinematic scenes.

Although the graphics and facial expressions are distinctive, the design of many characters is unattractive, whether their faces or their costumes, especially if they are not characteristic of other DC characters other than the well-known Batman, Superman, Robin, Wonderman, Harley Quinn, etc. and the character's movement during combat is somewhat upright, such as the character bending her legs to descend without moving her hands or the rest of her body.

The carefully crafted graphics gave the world an incredible vibe, and made exploration fun. The addition of swimming gave the experience greater freedom of movement, where characters could explore water and navigate seamlessly - something that was not available before. While it is possible to unlock the characters during the gameplay, the time required for each character is not as simple as that which will force players to buy the Battle Bass, which will cost them 40 dollars (about 150 reals), except for extra costumes and others. There is a marked imbalance between the strength of the characters' abilities which makes the experience unfair, especially for players who want to take the game more seriously.

game_name: Mutant Year Zero: Road to Eden
review_text: Mutant Year Zero: Road to Eden introduced a fun and innovative turn-based tactics gameplay style that combines hide-and-seek and direct combat with different skills, abilities, and weapons for each character that can be upgraded over time for more varied and exciting options in different battles while giving the player the freedom to do whatever he wants without restrictions, and regardless of the annoying camera the game suffers from simple technical flaws that won't be difficult to solve in the coming period, and a superficial story that starts excitingly but will soon be taken care of by the player.

Milestone could have offered the best steam bike racing game ever with MXGP Pro, but despite great graphics and gameplay developments, the game's lack of balance in difficulty, lack of edges and sharpening of its content, has placed it in the middle as one of the best racing games, but not the best, in my opinion, the studio needs a break through which it rearranges its papers and focuses on one or two titles a year to present them better rather than offering more than one title at an average level.

You can easily get an S rating for all of the game's missions once you've finished fighting with a super hit. The story only covers the events from the second half of the second season of the series to the end of the first half of the third season, ignoring a full season and a half of the events featuring some of the best battles in the series.

With three different types of physical punches, two (at least) special punches, and three different degrees of super punches per character, the game offers a higher degree of depth than you might expect from similar games.

This new collection consists of two volumes, each for $20 each, which alone is enough to drive even the most loyal players to these games, especially since the collections contain only a few exclusive titles.

Naruto to Boruto: Shinobi Striker introduced varied and useful gameplay options in either a factional system or weapons, abilities, skills, costumes, and accessories that allow each player to design the ninja fighter he dreams of, but unfortunately the development team never cared about the content of the individual game that presented repetitive tasks and boring events, unlike team play and the presence of 4 different competitive modes that allow eight players to face each other in fiery battles with somewhat random flaws.

NBA 2K17 continues its tradition of offering a more accurate and crisp version of the best basketball simulation series out there. And with more ball control options, better storytelling (but not great), and too many customization options, playing NBA 2K17 is incredibly fun despite its problems with slow internet connectivity.

NBA 2K18 is close to becoming the best integrated sports game, offering different gameplay styles to suit all tastes, so if you want to live the life of a basketball player, here's the MyCareer style, and if you want to build your dream team, here's the MyTeam style, and if you want to live the life of a club general manager, you can try the MyGM style, but that doesn't mean it's a complete game.

Continuing to suffer from excessive reliance on purchases within the game Microtransactions, it is difficult to develop your character without only real money.  My Team's packages are still unfair, and the rate at which you get an item worth is very low. Multiple communication problems and delayed response sometimes lead to you being kicked out of the game.

The basketball simulation series has a small portion that hides its shy face from players for not introducing anything new, we don't recommend any player who owns last year's version to buy this game, and there are graphic errors that make us recommend buying the game to no one except those who want to enjoy the experience of the story and have spent many years buying the game.

A new environment full of life and bright colors in NEIGHBORHOOD after moving to Venice Beach. Providing a new challenge with a new punch scale for a different experience and another depth of pitch tests the player's skill in speed and accuracy. Returning promotional badges or badge upgrade in a new character and way enables you to upgrade the abilities of some of the players in MyTeam. Continue to develop MyCareer's story with movie scenes and some fateful options that shape your player's career from high school to college league level and even book his NBA seat in an attempt to reach his father's professional level. Continue to support the weekly challenges and events loaded with awards from the crowd that bring you back to playing for hours.

The Visual Concepts team with 2K Sports was able to offer their best with NBA 2K22 to become the best in the series, starting with the varied changes experienced by some of the game's most important players, certainly developing a career that became the most prominent element with this year's release, and going through additions and enhancements to the game's style to emulate basketball players and add more challenge and fun at the same time, but it was possible that the game would show up better than it had been if the company were to emphasize its extreme need in terms of purchasing and monetizing systems such as series releases, which are available at their current and most up-to-date levels of the game, but if one of the game's developers and players were to make the best use of the game, this would certainly be the best option for players, but if the player were to make the best use of the game, they would certainly be able to make the best use of the game, but if the player were to make the best use of it, they would certainly be able to make the best use of it.

I noticed the absence of a bunch of players in the Draft period for career development. This is expected given the size and length of the rounds for a very long time, but it goes against the simulation and realism that the game seeks to offer. Internal purchases and the need for them, were and still are the biggest downside in the history of this series. Progress and development is slow in some rounds, and unfortunately you will find that the solutions are to buy the game's digital currency or spend too much time in these rounds to reach your goal.

In addition, the size gap has become a major factor in the under-basket attack. After reviewing the previous installment of the NBA 2K22 series, we mentioned that Studio Visual Concepts and 2K could offer a better version of the series, but we return to saying that the developer can already build on the progress made last year, successfully redesign and deliver greater improvements on edges that were not better than before, making this year's release the best and version that any basketball player has long desired, and we strongly believe that in the coming years, in the same way Visual Concepts develops and supports some points in the series, it will be on its throne to succeed in sports betting.
The amount of internal purchases in MyCareer is large The RPG elements in MyGM are superficial and irrational The progress in the game is too slow.

Motion and gameplay have become better than ever thanks to updates to the ProPLAY system and the new Rhythm Shooting system, which helped provide a smooth and better gaming experience than last year's version.

The new Shot Meter is excellent and the new jumps add a lot of fun to every Salary Cap match for the MyTeam development is an excellent addition that forces the player to use different formats and enables him to compete with other teams and see their style MyCareer story better than last year and gives you an idea of the pre-NBA era in the world of basketball as well as simulating your journey with the game if you're new to the series.
The offline edges, especially as MyGM has not received any updates, are still filling the game and the slow progress encourages players to turn to it.

Control of cars is somewhat heavy and sliding with turns is easy, but colliding with barriers and even trees doesn't make it look like they're made of paper. The game is somewhat lost between wanting to be a realistic and unrealistic car game. Add to this the fact that the movement is not as smooth as its competitors (30 frames instead of 60).

The game's graphics are beautiful, especially the cars, and the game takes place in Palm City, which is similar to the American city of Miami. There is beautiful lighting at night with neon lights and reflection of lights on wet roads and rainfall, while during the day the effect is weaker but still a beautiful game if not the smoothness of movement such as in the games Gran Turismo and Forza. Good variety and an open world offers different pleasurable environments. During the day you choose a race and you hear about raising money while at night you participate in races forbidden to you and publish your name.

The most annoying thing about the game is the random development and upgrading of cars, as each race has a proposed level and to reach it you must get speed cards Speed cards either by winning pre-race races and playing them or by purchasing them from game stores whose cards are renewed every ten minutes every half an hour. The cards that appear to you in the races in short form are a very ordinary lottery after a 30km race.You must get speed cards Speed cards either by winning pre-races and playing them or by purchasing them from game stores whose cards are renewed every ten minutes every half an hour.The cards that appear to you in the races are a very ordinary lottery after a 30km race.You can also choose a lottery that is less than the current level of your car!

Need for Speed Payback has tried to do a lot of new things without succeeding in any of them in the desired way, I have no problem with making a game out of a quote from another game and that's what the game did here which quoted many of the things found in Forza Horizon 3, but instead removed some of the essentials in the series such as the famous police chases, so it's now becoming akin to passing through certain checkpoints to escape from police cars.

In general, the game's content varies from major championships (Race, Off-Road, Drift, Drag, Runner) to side activities such as finding broken car parts and breaking records. Most of the activities you find on your way are rewarded by the game's Loot Crate box, which includes random contents from the game's action and settings for the mobile application. When one side of the game receives up to 750 hits, the player will also receive up to 10,000 hits in 30 seconds.

There are also cartoon effects such as wings when your car jumps and smoke when accelerating and turning strongly and give the game a distinctive look. There are quite a number of cars and the ability to adjust them, and a variety of challenges. Also, the game forces you to move slowly around its world so that you feel risky when you're loaded with money surrounded by the police. The game is similar to the previous Heat part with some minor changes, today it's a two-night, day-to-day session that collects money in each period.

The game doesn't add much to the series or racing games in general, the unidentified city and gameplay system based on the previous Heat and even the controls don't carry the traditional Criterion imprint that offers fun over realism.The characters and effects of their cartoons collide with the world drawing and the real cars and seem like a shameful step for change.The story, dialogues and sound effects are some of the worst I've ever seen and heard.

game_name: NEO: The World Ends with You
review_text: The game takes place in the Shibuya area of Tokyo and the city itself is an important character in the game with its stores, landmarks, fashions, and part of some puzzles. The music is great and very distinctive, it blends power and pop, and between those in English and those in Japanese. The music plays a major role in giving the game its distinctive character and ability in the first part. In addition to the game's distinctive graphics and music, the game's movements, movements, movements, memories, and gameplay characteristics, the game's characters can be adapted from person to person or game, and the game's gameplay can be adapted to a wide variety of features, such as gameplay, gameplay, gameplay, and gameplay.

game_name: NEO: The World Ends with You
review_text: There are some repetitions of tasks and some of them require you to constantly move around the world in search of a goal and often some areas close you down until you eliminate certain enemies which is a continuation of the game that I didn't find fun.

game_name: NEO: The World Ends with You
review_text: If you're looking for an unfamiliar experience and can say that it's also unique, then we might be able to suggest this game to you for what it's worth - mixing some puzzle solving, boss battles, controlling more than one character, etc. Provided you can adapt to its slow, sometimes provocative storytelling and the occasional feeling of boredom as a result of annoying repetitions and sometimes uncreative design of tasks.

There's a lot of walking either without anything happening or with a fight no different than before. Comparison must be made, and the story here is simpler and less impactful than in their previous game.

Like their first game, the graphics of the game are very beautiful and full of imagination, as well as the animation of the characters, which is like a special art piece when the camera is removed and you see mountains in the background moving at a different speed than before. Also, the music is suitable to create the atmosphere and play a larger role in a game free of dialogue. The story deals with elements such as motherhood and loss and tells of dramatic events and even trauma and diverse environment, similar to the previous developer's game GRIS.

game_name: New Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe
review_text: Like most parts of this series, it takes place after Princess Peach is kidnapped for the eleventh time. During your rescue you will see different environments in each world and some worlds present surprises by presenting stages in different artistic styles with a different design character than we used to in the series.

game_name: New Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe
review_text: The Switch version for some reason unified both commands into a single button, and this problem caused me to repeat several challenges and stages. If you play with four players, two of you will be forced to choose one of the easy new characters. The game offers only a few new melodies and a large percentage of them moved from the game New Super Mario Bros on the Wii that was released in 2009.

The game's relentless quest from beginning to end to add jokes and jokes one after the other succeeds in making us laugh all the time, and although the story based on the options doesn't offer much different results, it remains a journey worth going through with the cast of characters that will soon become your favorite.

The game is somewhat short in nature because it offers you only five worlds each with about 12 to 15 levels and you can finish all the worlds in an hour. the game only supports local team play. i wanted to offer network play with others that might encourage me to come back again after finishing all the worlds and challenges that the game offers.

Ni No Kuni 2 took bold steps compared to the first part, some of which were as good as introducing a different clash system that was faster and more diverse, and some of which were not as successful as eliminating real-world events permanently, yet the title presented a simple story that any fast-paced player and characters with excellent but very limited sound performance, an exciting virtual world and numerous adventures involving tens of hours of planning, development and fun battles would be involved in.

The game does not adopt the basic characters well, the moment someone joins your crew will become like a flower without any identity. So much so that some side characters have a more influential identity than the main characters' crew. The skirmish is very simple and does not require any kind of strategy and the only thing it offers is to prolong the life of the game. The game offers you the space to develop the level of Higgledies, weapons, armour and magic, but the game is very easy and you can finish it without having to develop these skills and there is nothing motivating in its development unless the game forces you to develop some of them so that you progress in the story.

Like the first part, the game world is full of variety and bright colors that have never been seen before in any other RPG game, and it's more performance-enhancing because unlike the first part, it works at 60 frames per second on PlayStation 4. The story isn't the most powerful factor in the game, but it's simple and diplomatically productive, with moments that make you happy and make you feel more connected to the game world and its characters. My most enjoyable moments were in the side tasks, but it was like any other RPG and it was more performance-enhancing because unlike the first part, it works at 60 frames per second on PlayStation 4. The story is not the most powerful factor in the game, but it's simple and diplomatically productive, with moments that make you feel happier and happier, which made me feel more connected to the game world.

The new comeback of the NieR Replicant game carries with it significant improvements to the style of play to be a good opportunity to experience an old classic title, but for an old player who has already gone through it has a new ending I don't know if he is willing to do much and much in order to access it for $60, plus there are errors and problems that have not been addressed or addressed from the old version that can make the new player hesitant and the old one cheating.

I wasn't interested in NieR: Automata or anything related to the game before it was experienced, but the distinctive narrative style and carefully crafted storytelling, the varied gameplay and the enemies who constantly forced me to change my gameplay, all contributed to my enjoyment of the experience to its end, but nevertheless the game suffered from repetition in the middle of the events and the modest graphical level of open zones, neglect of side-tasks, and reliance on a conversational system unsuitable even for smartphone games.

game_name: Nier: Automata - The End of YoRHa Edition
review_text: There are several different endings and you play multiple characters and you see the story from more than one person's perspective, and with continuous play and continuity after each end the secrets of the story will begin to appear to you more clearly. In addition to the surprises in the story and its sequences, there are also things in the first game you will not understand until you get more than one end. The story as a whole is a war between human machines and space machines, but there are many philosophical ideas that can be presented that give the story a deeper feel or movement that opens the game between the two players.

game_name: Nier: Automata - The End of YoRHa Edition
review_text: Compared to the original PlayStation 4 version, the graphics are close, even if the details are less, while the performance is less but proven. There are 4 levels of difficulty, but I didn't find any suitable, the gap between medium and high difficulty (Hard and Normal) is large rather than graded.

There are several weapons, most of which are fun and 4 or 5 enemies at a time test you on more than one level while fighting the bosses is simpler but remains exciting in its presentation. whether it's the shooter and the hit or the powerful moves based on button loading or even the moves from the wall towards the enemy and the uncompromising shots like the Izuna Drop all make it a chaotic system sometimes but always fun. The game moves you linearly between different regions and states like New York, Japan and Venice with some of its landmarks but with a Japanese character.

The three stages that added to the original game with the release of Sigma and featuring weak-sided characters in their design and in their character-fighting system are not optional but enforced and kill the rhythm of the game.

The present world is mostly colorful, repetitive, and large but disintegrating with a lot of flying or skiing on ropes or water to connect unconnected places. Even technically, the game is only acceptable, especially the quality of the surfaces.

A brilliant and skilled fighting system with the best of the best presented in the history of the series, a great diversity of weapons, movements, and strategic depth transformations with Blood Raven and Berserk Meter content additional challenges (Purgatory Gates and Combat Trials) encouraged to replicate smooth technical performance and customizable difficulty.

The game combines several fighting systems from parts of the series as well as new ones, and even the previous developer's game Metal Gear Rising Revengeance has a presence here. There are great moves like Izuna Drop, Flying Swallow, Ultimate Technique as well as the new system where you can turn swords into a much stronger one controlled by a calculator and use it to punish enemies who are interested in hitting you with an overwhelmingly powerful blow. There are several fighting systems in addition to new ones and even the previous developer's game Metal Gear Rising Revengeance has a presence here. There are great moves like Izuna Drop, Flying Swallow, Ultimate Technique as well as the new system where you can turn swords into a larger one controlled by a calculator and use it to punish enemies who are interested in hitting you with an overwhelmingly powerful blow.
A weak story and a dull main character design boring and repetitive levels of participation Ryu's limited and hopelessly disillusioned balance varies in the quality of leaders.

Most of the additional content is included in this release and compared to the original there are more playable characters.This package also offers 1080p/4K resolution on PS4 /Pro, Xbox One/X and 720p on Switch at an average of 60 frames per second.

Some technical errors I noticed especially during the final stages, such as the presence of monsters stuck in strange places and angles or the sudden suspension of the game, but they did not affect the experience in general.

Control of the game is classic and simple, but it is full of jumping, climbing, and skills that make you feel like you are controlling an actual ninja character and many tools you can choose from to play the game your own way, the game has largely succeeded in creating the experience of classic platformer gaming with modern mechanics without losing the brilliance of classic graphics. The style of graphics is very great, it is rare for a game to rely entirely on real-world graphics in this modern era, but this studio always relies on the time to revive the brilliance of the style at the time, as it has proven itself in the past, and the aesthetics of Blasphemy have proven to be the best in the game's field without losing the brilliance of classic graphics.

The fighting style of the game is very fun and very varied, I didn't feel the repetition of the fighting until after the end of the game story, the fighting is very polished and balanced and adds a great challenge to the player to finish the stages in general, the leaders in particular, and a great deal of movement in the first part. There is a great variety of weapons and armor, ending the game story and many side tasks, and I still find new weapons and armor and each weapon with a particular style and weight, abilities and characteristics that are different from the other weapons and the words apply to the armor, and the ability to develop your weapon or weapon in particular, and the ability to change the design of the weapon and armor and its appearance in general.

The game's storyline is very primitive and you won't be disappointed by its events, even the sound representation doesn't improve for games of this generation unfortunately. The stage designs are very repetitive and similar to different stages, most of the stages are the same design and almost the same track. The difficulty of the game is very variable and unbalanced, some stages are very easy and completed from the first experience and in very short time, and some stages have taken too long to be difficult and long!

No Man's Sky may not be the perfect game in all respects but is plagued by many operational and graphical problems, but it is certainly a bold move that took advantage of random generation technology to provide us with an amazing world of multi-dimensional size, shape and color diversity, forcing us to appreciate this game that the small Hello Games studio has been working on for many years.
genres: Adventure, Action, RPG, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: The style of play is superficial and sometimes chaotic, in short, you can control the character while hitting enemies close strikes and avoiding their strikes, along with long strikes, special moves, and the like. What I experienced was that playing was normal and I often encountered control and camera problems (sometimes you have to walk to areas not in the field of view of the camera), more than once you received strikes despite trying to avoid them. The game tells you that the strikes of enemies are synchronous with the rhythm of the music but with the beat it can never be relied upon to have more than one enemy or leader hitting different strikes.

Music is the basis of the game, each area and leader specializes in a type of music that harmonizes with the stage environment visually and audibly. The areas offer different types of music such as classical, pop, etc. but fit with EDM music. The sound performance is excellent as well as the characters are great, the dialogue of the main characters in the storylines is good, funny and noteworthy and the quality of the actors' performance is remarkable.

Nobunaga's Ambition: Taishi is a strategy game that takes place somewhat slowly and requires long hours of play, has a complex and seamless user interface and an annoying instruction system that is more than useful to newcomers, on the other hand, the title provides a wealth of historical information about feudal Japan, real characters and battles from that era.

Similarly, the proposed levels of each chapter mean that you will have to constantly move between the characters even if you want to continue the story of one character. Lastly, not all characters have funny or accurate stories, and each chapter follows the same style of going to a village and using your move and going to the enemy's castle (dungeon) and often simply the time of the leader.

The characters are two-dimensional and simple, but the enemies and especially the leaders when fighting can be large-scale with a lot of detail, and the game world is like a house of puppets and you look inside it. The music is also great and blends classic and modern melodies, but it also uses modern technology to add effects and give depth to the game graphics.

The side-task system is catastrophic and I don't know how the developers thought it was a good system in any way, so once you accepted the task there is no indication or information to tell you where to start the task and what to do, some tasks contain hints but most don't agree with them unfortunately, the difference in difficulty, which is considered to be a slightly better problem than the previous part but it hasn't been solved, you'll be surprised at times when you're overcome by the fact that there's a high level of leadership at level 14 in this area, and this is something that some people didn't understand at the time.

There's a lot of laughter and sadness together, and every character is very different from the gameplay or the character's actions, which made me feel stuck in the world of the game. The art direction is considered the best graphics ever and every time Square Enix outperforms itself, every 2D-HD version of the game will be more beautiful than its predecessor, and this may be due to the game's appearance on the new generation devices, which helped to make the art direction appear better. The character's versatility, the personality of some of the Final Fantasy characters was beautiful and the game's best character is considered the best graphics ever, and every time Square Enix outperformed itself, every 2D-HD game version will be more beautiful than its predecessor, and this may be due to the game's appearance on the new generation devices, which helped to make the art direction appear better.

The game's graphics are similar to an oil painting of Japanese folklore, with your movement and the movement of the world presented in lines as if from a drawing brush and drawing of the rose behind you, so even after more than 10 years it still has an attractive appearance, especially with its precision support for the right devices. The transformation of the dead world into one full of life and the sight of trees, grasses and flowers in front of you, is your main goal in the game, a scene that does not lose its power until it is repeated several times before you. The game takes place in Japan in the past and contains many historical and mythical characters that give it a distinctive characteristic, such as a lack of humanity.

The start of the game is slow and there are a lot of instructions from your assistant and frequent movie scenes such as nightlife scenes. Also, the world is divided into regions and moving between regions requires watching loading screens even if they are fast. Finally, there is a lot of fighting even though it is possible to avoid or escape from it. In general, the game is not for those who want intermittent quick sessions but rather requires long and full sessions. The graphics are getting more accurate, but the game's performance on PlayStation 4 Pro, Xbox One X and PC is limited to 30 frames per second unlike many re-releases from the same publisher and other publishers.

OlliOlli World offers us the experience of skiing that we hope to gain, and indeed the Roll7 team can extract its experience from previous parts of OlliOlli during this game, starting with its artistic appeal and distinctive handwriting, the game provided a visually pleasing board and enjoyable style of play.

The combat system not only tracks the roles but also the distance between you and your enemy plays an important role in some skills, moving the skills very smoothly as if watching the anime. Exploring is often fun as each character has his or her own skills to help you reach areas such as Luffy's ability to climb some distant places and Chopper's ability to reach narrow places due to his or her small size.

Although the exploration element is fun, it can sometimes get annoying, especially at the end of the game. Climbing this, breaking the wall and then climbing again, many of which caused me to be dissatisfied with the last part of the game. The game level is very easy and I did not face any challenge that made me think like most other role-playing games and there is no option to change the difficulty. Lack of option to automatically pass texts during conversations makes me bored in many movie clips, especially in such a game that involves a lot of conversations.

I don't think there's anything that will make you buy this game, the short story and the way it's narrated is very weak and boring, the open world is very limited and there are very few activities, you might like the little skill tree to open up fun combat moves and a great design for the game world and its characters, with a variety of enemies characters and their fighting mechanism, but this really isn't the developer's invention but the original animation, and even the greatest animation lover can get close to this boring and weak experience.

Lack of diversity in the basic tasks, most of the basic tasks are centered around Lovie and one of the new game's characters Jane. Each task starts with a conversation about a particular topic and then Lovie goes to solve the problem. I wish the game could use one of the straw hat crew characters effectively to diversify the style of the tasks a little. As an open world game, it does not contain the varied content and details known to current games, while at the same time offering strange moments, before the fight shows you that one of your team members will help you in the fight but when the fight begins you will find yourself alone.

The story is self-contained and unrelated to any particular event in the series until it opens the way for anyone to enjoy its exciting world. Lovie is the most suitable character to navigate in an open world as a rubber man, so if you want to travel long distances, just set the indicator on trees, buildings, or boards and automatically tap into the area that you can tap into and then move to, such as a shooter.

game_name: One Piece: Pirate Warriors 3 Deluxe Edition
review_text: One Piece: Pirate Warriors 3 chronicles many of the events of the anime in up to 20 hours, and the game has already succeeded in summarizing the events of the anime in that time without missing any important element of the anime events, the game also offers an easy and seamless gameplay in a series of popular anime islands, to provide you with hours of fun despite the game's great ease and some of the interactive dialogues that make me unable to understand all the events well, but it is ultimately a unique experience on the Switch.

A good number of characters, including 43 playable characters including the Four Emperors (Yonko), and the Admirals of the Navy, include Japanese voice acting, which gives the feeling of watching the anime. Each character has its own movements that distinguish it based on its abilities as an anime, and the beauty is also that in the form of playing a white beard, for example, the size and strength of the character give the feeling that you are playing a distinctive character and the difference in strength between him and the usual characters is felt.

The game still requires you to save a certain character in the middle of a fight, or help another character escape, or other tasks that we have invaded with all the developer games in the various series. Also, when fighting is supposed to be based on the story, the design of the task requires you to win, and then it shows you that you have lost the movie, which loses the moment. The movie clips used in the game were made with the game engine, and were not fun to watch, it was best to keep the animated footage from the game as it happened with Berserk.

The newest part of this series of games is the best yet, with an extensive list of available characters, a fun and crazy gameplay system, refreshed tasks in form and some functionality, and may also be your best choice if you're a fan of this type of game.
The gameplay hasn't improved and the old game still isn't available on the platforms of the new generation.

The funny adventures of Ratchet and Clank have always been a reliable recipe for having a fun and exciting time, and Rift Apart brings this essence in turn. But it's hard to ignore the fact that the game could have offered so much more than it did, as the new features added by the various dimensional mechanisms fail to provide enough excitement to allow the game to reach its true potential.

There are some technical problems, especially in platforming and jumping over objects where my character has been stuck more than once and had to be stored in some of them, even after the first day update.
