review_text: I've never seen a better game than this classic title that quotes from a cartoon series and offers very entertaining content, and this new version is an excellent opportunity for any player who hasn't forgotten to experience this great game.

Spyro's comeback has a lot of positives and a bunch of negatives, beautiful graphics, amazing sounds and worlds can't be more beautiful than this, but the lack of content, problems with control, boredom and repetition after a few hours, is what worries us about these new releases.

Fewer performance on the mobile mode of the switch in terms of frames, as you may notice from time to time from squares or pixels in the scenes.Some traditional ideas and strategies may have been appropriate in their time but by today's standards are boring and annoying.

With it, the characters seem alive and more interactive with their details, features and expressions. The world is also created with a variety of environments and bright colors from green gardens to icebergs. It is worth noting that the quality of the images is excellent on the steady state of the switch, the performance of the steady frames and approaches to the PlayStation 4. The world is almost open and offers you the freedom to move and explore between different worlds and various special challenges such as flight and hockey matches.

The combat system is smooth and varied due to the variety of characters, skills, and the ability to change the character quickly, which makes me feel like I'm playing Final Fantasy 7 Remake.The funniest thing I've seen in games with a wide world is that they not only add speed, but also the ability to access secrets and hidden places in the world.

The writing bumps that affected the story, the film, the event, made me feel excited or sad because of the weak conversations, and even if something interesting happened, some compulsive side-tasks would interfere in your way, making you feel like the events aren't as important as the design of the characters on paper and in the drawings, but their appearance in the game is so funny that I couldn't bear to see the face of the protagonist Raymond with technical performance problems despite the less common drawings, but the game faces difficulties in the stability of the frames.

game_name: Star Ocean: The Second Story R
review_text: The artistic orientation, which maintained the essence of the original orientation, the blending of pixel elements with three-dimensional elements and sophisticated lighting made every corner of the world super-beautiful and contrasted with high-quality pixel games such as Octopath Traveler 2, and the character graphics displayed during the chats showed the aesthetics of designing characters in the best possible image and adding a lot to the dialogue and displaying character expressions through which the addition of a character to summon the heroes of the Star Ocean parts during the fight was good and each story had its own unique punch that might twist the game's character balance.

game_name: Star Ocean: The Second Story R
review_text: The slight improvements to the fighting system were not enough to make it more modern, such as the slow response of the avoiding button, which was added to improve and deal with toxins that may interfere with the player's movement for a few minutes and require certain treatments, spells or accessories that protect you from poison damage but are very rare and you can't carry more than 20 of the same treatment, which made the situation intolerable in some confrontations and didn't fit the existing mechanical fighting system's level of difficulty, so much so that you'll have to collect experience points to increase your levels every minute, which has caused the game to run slowly and this is a problem in every way in general, and this is a strange problem because the death of any character in the game can only require that the characters in the game, such as Star Wars, have the opportunity to re-create or re-create their characters, and this means that some of the characters in the game will not be able to reproduce or reproduce their characters, or that they will not be able to reproduce any of the characters in the game.

EA and DICE were able to evoke the style and atmosphere of the original Star Wars Battlefront. The refined visuals and attention to detail are impressive, and the gameplay is smooth and exciting. However, the game lacks content and would have benefited more if it had included the season pass in the original game from the start.

The story gives you the opportunity to experience several characters and vehicles, each with different abilities, renewing the experience for the player and not getting bored of playing the same thing throughout the story. It is a very distinctive collective gameplay, despite the lack of action in the game, but the difference between each gives the game a long life. The most enjoyable part of the story is that the heroes against the various villains (Heros vs Vailins) and the four heroes of the four teams compete against each other, and that each team in the game will have the ability to change from one person to the other, so that each player will have the ability to play fourteen different roles at the same time.

With the exception of fighting vehicles, you won't feel the benefit of having them with you, but on the contrary, they may cause you to lose some of the tasks due to random moves. The problem of having to restart the game is catastrophic in the sense of the word. Advancing in this 1200-step game depends heavily on the card. There are ways to get to the card, especially the card, but you will need to know the number of cards and cards you want to use, but you will need to know the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, the number of cards, etc.

Respawn Studios was finally able to present the Star Wars game we've been waiting for for years, the game was able with its good story and special charm with a fighting style that makes you feel like one of the Jedi, combined with the exploration element and the freedom of play that the game gives you, the distinctive barcor elements you've experienced, as well as the various mysteries and variety of game environments, animations, and unique sounds it provided, made it offer us an artwork that we haven't seen much of lately and in return for the disappointment of previous Star Wars titles.

The actual bosses in Star Wars Jedi: Survivor are of a good level but very few in number for a game with an average age of over 25 hours. Additionally, the game relies on the use of some enemies of the higher classes, giving them a distinctive name and a health bar in the upper half of the screen in an effort to convince the player that these are bosses' fights.The Jedha region is considered a semi-open region like the Koboh region but unfortunately did not provide side content of the same abundance and quality.Some technical problems with the PlayStation 5 version of the game resulted from decreases in frames in some areas and problems with image clarity that could cause side effects such as Checkerboard rendering.

Major expansion of the combat side in Star Wars Jedi: Survivor while maintaining its impact on gameplay like Sekiro with the ability to change the use of Lightsaber between 5 different modes, each with its own skill tree, and which provided a great variety and fun in the combat mode, especially the lightsaber mode in the right hand and the firearm in the left hand.

Despite the graphics and nice technical orientation, the technical aspect is weak on the consoles, the game is not clear in all aspects of the graphics and the HDR option is not finely polished, which forced me to cancel its activation to get the best colors in the game. Moving in the game is reckless and does not carry any weight, for example, hand punches do not withstand any collisions, making them look weak and do not have any fun, and this problem is also evident in the features of characters who do not have any emotions during conversations and in some film footage.

The design of regions and the vast world embodied the atmosphere of Star Wars in a way unprecedented in any Star Wars game, especially the vibrant environments and cities that vary from region to region, and the different fashions and behaviors of people and unplayable characters in each city, which gave me the feeling that it is a real world with its diversity and beauty. The reputation system added a lot to the game, your choice of tasks and conversations will only affect areas where you can access and change a lot of people interacting with you.

The quality of the game and the amount of options available when piloting the warplane give you room to learn how to easily pilot the vehicle, but there are personal skills that require you to develop so that you can stand out and outmaneuver other pilots, a system that is easy to understand but skillful and distinctive needs to develop your skills.The collective gameplay is divided into two divisions.The first is a battle between two teams of five pilots, each pilot attempting to shoot down as many enemy aircraft as possible to collect points, and the team with the most points is the winner, a plain gameplay system mostly without planning between you and your teammates, but the second is a battle between the two world champions.

By playing for hours consecutively between regular play and VR, it becomes clear to me that the game was originally designed for an outstanding experience, but without VR I found that the game lacks the sense of being on the plane and easily moving your head to see your enemies, and also that you have difficulty realizing what is happening around you in space as easy and simple as it is in VR.

After more than 120 hours of play, the game's experience was still lacking and severely lacking for real exploration! It relies entirely on the production of random areas, and even on the hand-crafted areas of the game does not give the player the opportunity to explore cities and regions like New Atlantis, Cyd, Akila, or Neon. Once the game's experience is filled with real-world missions and activities without any interaction with the people around you, Starfield's presence in the game's environments varies dramatically depending on the nature of the game's gameplay and the interaction between the game's environments.

A fascinating story with characters, conversations, and shocking surprises, a smooth style of play, and tremendous freedom to enjoy in exploring a dynamic world of more than 1,000 planets, a system of role-playing games perfectly mastered by the design of key and side-by-side tasks of the best I've ever seen, such as a flight simulator experience, scenic drawings, sound effects, and videotape music at the highest level, and that's the first time we've seen it from Bethesd Studios, all you need is a £90 subscription to experience this masterpiece.
Some minor flaws that did not affect the experience as a whole.

The game introduced the New Game Plus side in a different style and thought on paper essentially perfectly, but unfortunately matched some of the notes on the story that we will remember alongside the flaws. The team's task lines, especially the Crimson Fleet, were level between good and excellent and the game was able to present the events, characters, and designs of the main story's best missions. The game's layout was very fun and portable and the game was heavily armed with weapons.

Starlink: Battle for Atlas offers a unique experience for the fans of the games of aircraft and space, and despite the repetitiveness of many tasks and the exorbitant amount you may have to pay to get all the physical games in the game, the style of play is fun and the fees are very special and the addition of Star Fox on the Switch is the best part of the game.

As for the exclusive missions on the Fox pilot switch like the other missions, they do have cinematic scenes and ultimately epic combat. The planets, although their terrain is different, but they will repeat the same missions and specific activities, making visiting all the planets a bit boring. Throughout the length of the game you will only see the bodies of the characters in the main menu and the movie clips and you will not be able to get out of a ship that has sailed on the planets on foot, and if there are any ships and ships that show up on the planets, you will be able to enjoy the game.

There is no satisfying feeling like seeing your ship fly off the planet's surface and penetrate its atmosphere to get you into vast space. In space you will pass around the asteroids, the wreckage of massive cargo ships to explore and finally the pirate ships that are trying to stop you and their main positions that you can destroy. As a feature of the galaxy system and the ability to navigate within the planets to help you in your quest for resources, you will be able to make money, defend yourself, and even doubt the speed of the spacecraft.

State of Decay 2 is one of the best survival and zombie games I've tried on the current generation of devices, it's an open world progression game that gives you a lot of freedom to do whatever you want and set up your base in the way you see fit, the real fun of the game is to collaborate and collaborate with your friends in a hundred zombie buses, and it's a great RPG that's definitely worth a try compared to its price of just $30.

Steelrising was able to provide a distinctive storytelling experience in an alternate world during the French Revolution, and unlike the story I liked a lot and the distinctive faces that would be interviewed within the game, the developer missed a great opportunity during a gameplay style that was largely limited and not fun, as well as the diversity of enemies and weak leaders, although there were some unforgettable fights that were not enough to overlook the core problems of the game.
Arabic translation is not the best the game has some technical problems the game suffers from some repetition in design.

The style of play is challenging, but more flexible than the original Soul games, and the design of the world is innovative and different from the Soul games to which we are accustomed, with the ability to customize and modify weapons, the main character, and various abilities.

Adding the Become a Legend story takes you on an Olympic adventure from first practice, to qualifying, then to the playoffs and even to the finals, which includes short documentaries of famous skiers. The game world is still fascinating with the addition of new exploration sites from Japan and South Korea, each with its own identity with wooden huts and cherry trees. You can also control the time to listen to the plants whenever you grow up.
While the expansion is primarily based on Pyeongchang 2018, it lacks the Olympic atmosphere, there is no opening ceremony or coronation after winning three gold medals.

The fighting system, which relies on your timing to hit and avoid the right time, is similar to the game Sekiro, but it also relies on your attack using sequential strikes or the various skills found in the game, and all of these highly sophisticated skills were employed in what I consider to be the most exciting encounters of this generation. The game's content is rich in side-tasks and exploration and reward your time, some of the most interesting tasks are from dialogues, story and even rewards, and all of these highly sophisticated skills have been employed in contests that I consider to be the most exciting in this generation.

The game's exploratory map is somewhat annoying, especially as it does not contain enough details or instructions, and the mini-map disappears every few seconds and you have to press the touch button to show it again. Poor vocal performance and simply the emotions in English, which is the language most people would choose but unfortunately does not connect the desired image to the characters or even the story due to poor representation, changing the language from English to Korean has changed the experience a lot. The elements of climbing and jumping are weak in the game and not polished, which is the aspect I considered the worst in the game.

The budget of the game is simple and we see games at similar prices or cheaper with higher budgets such as Bright Memory.The lack of dialogue I see as a smart option, but the length of the game and the simplicity of the fees may be a barrier to some.

Comedy is a big factor in the game, and many of the scenes are funny and unusual, and the game succeeds in doing so despite the fact that it does not involve conversations or that may be the reason, as it succeeds in narrating its story with gestures, expressions, and scenes themselves. Your character will move from the prison where she died to the treasure through a ship, a city, etc., and you will face funny scenes and challenges. The gameplay is generally close to the time it takes to play it. The gameplay is simple but it serves the purpose of a game of events and stories, so you need to approach a ship without discovering the action only when the enemy does not see you, and the gameplay is quick to replicate some of the enemies, and the viewer will require you to play the game with one or more of the characters.

It's true that there are more than one type of puzzle, but unfortunately some of them are too easy, and some of them repeat the method more than once, causing this important element to lose its value at times. At each stage there is a secret door full of treasures, and to open it players must find 6 replicas of cats hidden on the map.

The design of the world is beautiful, and it feels like you're actually going on an adventure in an abandoned place cursed with something. It's also nice that each stage of the game is slightly different from the previous stages but maintains the overall atmosphere of the game. The commentator The person who speaks during the game and comments on the events was a successful addition. His description of the events in an exaggerated and derisive way or commenting on some of the decisions made by the player made me try a lot of things just to hear what he's going to say. There are about 3 or 4 types of puzzles in the game.

game_name: Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin
review_text: Stranger of Paradise takes us on a completely different journey than any previous adventure in the Final Fantasy universe by relying heavily on the elements of Souls games combined with difficulty options that welcome those looking for easier encounters, gives the title a distinct style of play as we are accustomed to Team Ninja with a variety of categories, each offering completely different skills, mechanisms, weapons and tools, enemies that bring back your memories with previous FF games, and unique designs that provide a fantastic level of challenge, but in return the story suffers from various problems from its beginning to its final stages, and the characters do not have any functionality or performance characteristics, and the characters do not have the same functionality as their competitors.

Stray is an exceptional game, and its introduction to the new play experience with playing the character of a loving cat is only a small part of the game.  The way the story is told is very exciting, supported by amazing paintings and works of art, along with the soundtrack, which I hope will receive a separate release after launch.  This little game independent of BlueTweleve Studio offers a lot of content despite its relatively short 8-hour campaign, which can easily be considered one of the best games of the year.
You can jump only at certain points and when the icon of the jump button appears, which means that the only skill challenge is to move the camera until the icon appears.

The game world is one of its strongest points, it is a post-apocalyptic world similar to games like Cyberpunk, but all its inhabitants are machines trying to simulate humans, to the extent that there are restaurants, dancers, and even hairdressers! there are memories you find that embrace the game world and tell its story in an engaging way. You control a cat and a little robot helps you to open doors, talk to machines, etc. In addition to jumping and moving quickly like any cat, the game controls the role of the cat with sounds, scanning others, and even sleeping in random places, which adds to the game's characteristic for cat lovers. Most of the game is about exploration, and being a cat means that most of the places are accessible, and all of the game's modern languages and missions are accessible to everyone, but the game's gameplay takes a relatively short time, which means that you need to get back to the land, which is a relatively short time, which means that you need to explore some of the characteristics of the game.

Maintaining the spirit of the original game and returning after a 26-year absence. Amazingly artistically animated cartoons keep pace with the times. Great diversity in enemies and how to fight them. Different set of characters that you can play with. The ability to tell the story with your friend online or local. Stage design is characterized by variety. The game environment can be used to defeat enemies.

The movements of the hero characters are all based on fighting horizontally, which is the traditional order in the series and there are no vertical moves as opposed to what some enemies can do with strikes, Bodie was developing the series to match our current time and this mechanism is being introduced more and become a better way to avoid strikes and make the game more enthusiastic and enthusiastic with the speed of playing with horizontal, longitudinal and uniform mechanics. The variety of combat blows between the sum total of front and rear strikes pushes the opponent backwards, a special-strike weapon that consumes some of the character's energy, but you can recover that energy if you direct consecutive blows and strikes to the opponent, the ability to mount the opponent with a correct grip to apply certain blows or throws into the air, and also the application of quick skills to shorten the distance between you and the opponent or the reverse of the fleeing opponent when gathering them around you, are all applied smoothly, giving you the same feeling as the original series with the development of simple strikes and adjustments to the timing of the strikes, the speed of the strikes, and the continuity of Floyd's movements.

game_name: Suikoden I & II HD Remaster: Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars
review_text: The backdrop was completely redesigned, as well as the images of the main characters and the soundtracks were improved to make it look like a new game with a classic atmosphere like Sea of Stars instead of an improved old game. Combat acceleration also added a practical feature to this version, with 3 elements of difficulty and even a revised and improved translation of the original. In addition, the player for the game's movie scenes, music and artwork was made available to finish each game. The two games were great in their time and still have the speed of events as well as the sensitivity and mobility of the game in general.

review_text: There are no additional advantages beyond what we have seen in the improved versions of similar games such as avoiding fighting altogether or making characters not die or speeding up conversations, and even the advantages of taking action to speed up the fight also speed up the music as if the game were simulated and returning to normal speed with the start of each fight and useless automatic storage that sometimes separates between one and the other hours of play.

The variety of characters adapted from other Konami games such as Simon Belmont, Alucard, and Solid Snake suits the game's graphic and fun design, each with its own characteristics and role, some with speed and others with attack. The new variety of characters, with a classic and well-preserved character, is similar to what some fans of the series expect to be simple and fun, but there are characters like the main character, which is particularly similar to the gameplay.

review_text: Although the story is so short-lived that it is full of boring goals, especially the first world, which requires you to collect 100 of Ellon's creatures scattered around the world, you may find some difficulties and challenges along the way, such as some puzzles or attacking enemy bases to save some of the small creatures, but they are naturally repetitive and have not added to diversity or fun. The game's graphics are less than ordinary and have no artistic orientation that distinguishes them from some games with the same graphics system. It is very simple and uninspiring.

As a platform game, it's sophisticated and beautiful with good control, no slow response like the New series, and with a diverse stage design, different powers, and the ability to play collectively, with good content between the stage and the secret.Being a Nintendo game means that there are options for younger people and limited experience, and even for the traditional player if he needs help, there are characters who don't get hurt (unless he falls into a hole), and there are signs that give you power or help such as jumping to the top or getting a fight from the start and choosing between them before the start of the stage and being able to win it.What makes the game unique is the adventure (Wonder) in which the majority of the players are able to reach and help themselves when they need help, there are characters who don't get hurt (unless they fall into a hole) and there are signs that give you power or help such as jumping to the top or getting a fight from the start and you can get it.

game_name: Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2
review_text: The game takes you out of the world after you get the star even if it is a side star and not the main one you chose. It takes you out of the world and even off the map to get you back to your vehicle and crash into the back-to-vehicle scenes and go to the map or re-stage. In mobile mode, the mode requires scrolling or tilting to move instead of moving the indicator, which is a solution that lacks smoothness but may be the best possible.

game_name: Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2
review_text: The original game was technically remarkable and varied, the galaxy's appearance is superb, but the worlds presented are dynamic and mechanical, covering all climates, the game's performance is excellent, and these versions raise the precision to match today's requirements (1080p on Switch 1 and the mobile version for Switch 2 and 4K on Switch 2 as well as TV). These versions are better than the Super Mario Galaxy 1 version released 5 years ago on Switch (with the same surface quality). The music is also noteworthy, especially that of the complete orchestral composition and you can now listen to it from the game.

In addition to the four games that combine two switches together to give a different perspective on the TV screen, the characters are not just figurative as a strategic character has been added with dice, each character has a different stone, some of which has a high risk such as losing money and other rewards carrying rewards such as several aspects of the number 6.

The game is not designed for single-player play and may not be considered negative, but you can play all the games alone and although you have several levels of difficulty (easy, medium, difficult and very difficult) they are all easy and there is hardly a slight difference in competition. The most annoying thing is the artificial intelligence of the characters that will be noticed in games that require collaboration, the goal being in front of you but for some reason your partner is moving away from it.

A variety of maps in the form of boards combine classicity and modernity, and usually each board has unique characteristics and features that change the style of play. The fact is that part of the game's challenge is to anticipate results, but you may find yourself frustrated if you're more skilled than the other players and lose your progress to get the star. Additionally, as a professional, you'll often find that luck plays an important role in determining the ultimate winner in the form of a board, you may be advanced throughout the game and suddenly find yourself the last one just before the end of the round.

While there are a huge number of mini-games out there, you'll soon see them repeat themselves in a number of ways. You may face some problems with the accuracy of the motion control in the action games with the Joy-con. During your game you may get a companion, the jamboree buddy, who based on his personality offers you some sort of help or preference in the game, but soon your joy disappears as to how easily he stole it from you.

game_name: Super Mario Party Jamboree - Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Jamboree TV
review_text: As is usually the case in the series, some games are boring and luck plays a significant role in changing settings. Also, many of the side-effects and half of the mini-games are exclusive to them rather than being in the main role as well. The add-ons of this version are somewhat superficial and short - there are 3 similar audio games and 3 with the camera and this version is a third more expensive - they are not free add-ons.

game_name: Super Mario Party Jamboree - Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Jamboree TV
review_text: The difference between the parts is mainly based on the quality of the games themselves and the stages, and in this part we see a large variety of mini-games that are good overall, although they are short-lived, as well as many stages that are diverse in design and difficulty. One of the best parts in this aspect and if not the best part. There are several different parts other than the main game, including an 8-player game and a 20-player race, and they can be played with other players on the network or on the computer.

Beautiful graphics, diverse environments, some with ideas like a hill where stars fall, a Viking castle where a train passes or a pirate wants to fight you, as well as beautiful music (except perhaps fighting music) and there are two versions: original and modern, and I found myself constantly switching between them. Each Mario game, there are some platforms in Mario that can prevent enemies from shaking over them and some areas that need some jumping to get to certain places. The fighting system is simple but easy and the idea of interacting with the fighting lists is to punish you, to punish the enemy or to punish the enemy.

Even with the game's old-fashioned updates, the zones are divided into smaller zones that move between them rather than being connected, and in the latter part of the game there is some repetition before you are allowed to pass, and the weapons come in order and the new one is always stronger than before, so there is actually no choice for the best habit.

There is a repetition of stages and over time the game becomes standard if you play it alone often. Also the level of difficulty increases dramatically and becomes frustrating especially with the inability to see the goal at times becoming a matter of luck and experience rather than skill. Some modifications in motion physics may upset fans of the original game.

It's simple, but the challenge is simple, whether it's choosing the right path or skipping the narrow roads, and the stages of the second part add switches to open the way for you, and the developer succeeds in creating multiple stages based on these basics. The excitement and tension turns into a triumphal excitement in the advanced stages. The content is rich, there are over 300 stages, either the story of the second part or the stages of the challenge and training of the second part and the references, as well as collective elements such as music, melodic content, personality and music.

The game introduces only four new stages and a set of stages that appeared in previous installments. Playing online is a disaster in every way. The game from my experience faces continuous interruption during combat. The graphics and quality improvements retained the character of the original games and designs very carefully, but were updated to make them more modern, especially the character of Lara Croft, which retained its cubic shape but has more detail and higher quality than before, and this applies to all games from the environment and characters in the game. The Last Revelation is considered one of the best parts of the old series and has improved with the changes in gameplay and control.

The series is known for its music from rock and rap songs, which is particularly enthusiastic and fast-paced, to suit the exciting and risky skiing atmosphere. As for the re-release, it includes original game music and new music on the series.

For a game described as the "spiritual heir" to the beloved RPG released in 1999, Torment not only succeeded in capturing the spirit of Planescape: Torment, which makes us yearning, but at the same time managed to get rid of old stereotypes and add enough new ideas to stand out as an excellent game in itself.

game_name: Towa and the Guardians of the Sacred Tree
review_text: The style of play is different from the rest of the game, so controlling two characters, one focused on magic and the other on direct hit at the same time, is a fun idea and reminds me of Bayonetta Origins and Astral Chain, the game's artistic direction is fantastic, it combines three-dimensional characters and backgrounds painted in the style of okieoh (the traditional Japanese art of drawing) The game looks charming and worthy of praise in every aspect of the game's music from the composer Hhi Sakimoto, known for his work on Final Fantasy games and the variety found in the music genres that were fun to hear and similar to Final Fantasy 12 to the extent that the game adapts to the many ways in which characters can be customized with you, and the way in which you can even make your own sets and scenes (such as the characters and the characters).

game_name: Towa and the Guardians of the Sacred Tree
review_text: The wizarding character, called  Kagura, is very limited in control and bored to play, which makes joint play unpleasant because it will force the second player to control the secondary character despite the existence of 8 playable characters until most of them have very similar abilities, and I didn't feel the huge difference between them.

Trackmania Turbo is a very fun game whether you play it alone or with your friends.With its simple mechanics and excess content, you always have a reason to go back to the magical and chaotic world of Trackmania.

Good and varied content, there are 65 races, spread over 5 groups, plus an online competitive round, in which you compete with 99 other people to finish the road in the shortest time possible. Beautiful graphics, brightness and high speed, with great jumps and racing at 90 degree angles and even 180 degrees. Also find other players smooth and fast. Even the re-run of the race takes place instantly. Control is simple, non-realistic, but relies on fast movement, but you will spend a lot of time getting to know the game, especially with some routes that punish you for making mistakes. The ability to make routes yourself, and share them with others.

There are no storylines, no new cars you get as a prize, and you only play against time and not against other cars. You will buy this version to make and play more player-designed ways than the available ones. The ManiaPlanet platform is complex and its listings are not a series specific to newcomers on it, and even if you buy this version from Steam you will have to use it.

The fighting system is one of the best aspects of the game, as it combines elements of the fighting systems of the RPG action games and the multiplayer system in a distinctive way, where you can fight enemies without engaging in multiplayer battles, but you won't do much damage to the stronger enemies unless you engage in turn-based combat.

The voice performance of the characters, except for Olivier's character, is poor, especially in English, and I have missed some emotional moments that were almost fantastic if not inferior to the performance of some voice actors.The interface looks complex, with its design based on overlapping lists within other lists, which made me uncomfortable at first, especially when it comes to Orbment lists.The music of the game is frequent, where the same music is reused in similar situations, places and confrontations, making the sound experience as a whole oblivionable and sometimes annoying.

Transference deals with some heavy and important themes, which are cleverly captured through the game's visuals and storytelling, and shows the absolute madness of a man who tirelessly seeks to achieve his seemingly impossible goal. But where the game fails is its short duration and its puzzles that seem to become easier over time. There is nothing tempting to recreate the game again (unless you want to collect all the video and audio recordings), which greatly reduces the value of recreating the game.

game_name: Travis Strikes Again: No More Heroes
review_text: The story is very superficial and has no purpose or meaning even after you've finished the game. The game suffers from some technical problems, when visual effects are achieved, the game starts to crumble slightly but noticeably. the problem is that it sometimes causes an imbalance. the upward rhythm of the game is very slow. you will play a lot of easy stages until you reach a certain level. you can play the intermediate difficulty stages, the problem is that easy stages only require the player to master the basics of control, and in which the player will be able to easily overcome all the challenges and play a lot of them until the higher difficulty stages open up to him. the game system. except for motorcycles, everything you get through the lucky boxes, which you get through the game. the problem is that easy stages only require the player to master the basics of control, and in which the player will be able to easily overcome all the challenges and play a lot of them until the higher difficulty stages open up to him.

The precision of movement and interaction with the environment makes mastery of the control and completion of the stages a very enjoyable challenge, and encourages re-stage design for better numbers. Or in terms of focusing on a particular aspect of the control, such as balancing the bike in the air, or choosing the right timing for acceleration, which takes advantage of the game control and highlights it outstandingly.

I don't think you should hesitate to buy this game if you are a fan of the series, there is enough content and fun here for many hours of play, with extensive and beautiful personality and bike customization options, a lack of online features and some minor problems is what keeps it away from the full brand.
The game is so heavily packed with dialogue that it often seemed excessive and unnecessary, and the voice acting of some characters is poor.

The story has a similar political nature to Final Fantasy Tactics, which is full of twists and surprises, and the decisions you make through conversations greatly affect the outcome of many battles, adding a powerful element to the replay element. The game generally did not offer a significant or noticeable change from the other parts, you will feel as if you are playing one of the previous parts but better drawings and elsewhere. review_text: Even 23 years later, the game is still fun and requires skill, even if it is simpler than current fighting games. The world is packed with treasures that encourage you to explore the world, whether in open fields or underground areas. The fighting system is fast and relies on assigning your characters different functions as well as having each character have their own movements and three different types of weapons. The fighting system is fast and loose and also has limited planning, and the development of the game requires that the game's gameplay and the gameplay of the game become more complex and complex.

The story is superficial, starting with revenge and then a large percentage of the interfaces are centered around the miscommunication between the characters without any other factors motivating you to fight. The game is a single-player game with only two players in the challenge and requires two machines and two versions of the game, without the ability to exchange roles with the same machine.This is the main reason why I wish there was a version of the game on the Switch.The rewards you get in the game are by using the sharks you earn from playing to open these rewards randomly, which means you will play a lot and be at the mercy of luck.

The challenge is to understand what you have to do and execute in these limited seconds, and the game is often comedic in nature (such as pulling a poem in a person's nose, or keeping an umbrella over cats moving to protect them from the game) so that speed, challenge, and laughter are combined into a fun format.

The game has somewhat lost its simplicity, so instead of simple games requiring a simple movement only once you grasp its goal, most games have become more complex, requiring movement and interaction, which may be considered a change but results in games becoming more difficult to win from the first time, sometimes by accident, and even saving has become important.

Watch Dogs 2 is designed for those who love open world games full of options and at the same time for those who love the experience of playing games full of fun and whimsy and not for those who love killing, using guns and following an action-packed story. and it was able to gracefully embody the city of San Francisco, adding technology that is up to date with this era that allows you to control the environment around you and make you the master of the city. it was also designed as a gateway away from the heavy, action-packed conventional games.
A funny story, though somewhat ordinary and superficial, good movie scenes with excellent actors, funny and humorous characters even if some of the conversations and jokes are silly or exaggerated.

The game doesn't have a single protagonist and offers a recruitment system in which you can recruit anyone you want in the world (except for the main characters), and each player has advantages and disadvantages, a historical record and a schedule of their lives and relationships and sometimes changes as you progress in the game or a decision made by you. Thinking about how the developer designed this system is like crazy and I can't explain it yet, especially since many possibilities and traditional development consider it almost impossible. review_text: Long add-on may be considered a separate game in its own right as it may take more than 20 hours to complete.Add-on improvements to the combat system include adjustments to lists and the ability to change blades during combat instead of using one facility throughout the battle as in the original game.Community add-on is a system that allows you to expand your own community by joining people by completing their side missions and helping them, rewarding you with many tools and prizes.

review_text: The story bounces back and forth until the end, and there are almost no surprises unlike the events of the original game. game_name: Ys Memoire: The Oath in Felghana
review_text: The game's music is considered one of the Japanese RPG legends and has been refined by raising the quality of the music and making it more modern. The diversity of the leaders and the differences in their weaknesses and the way they face you make you think a lot like you're solving a puzzle, which adds a lot of variety to the gameplay and greatly increases the fun of the game. The control of the ship is slow and takes some time to get used to, but it accounts for about 30% of the game in terms of being the primary means of opening up new islands and places. Your change of weapon does not change its shape at all, and the basic weapon does not change its shape in any way, but the landscape of any sword can be seen at the beginning of most games. Losing this element in a three-dimensional RPG game reduces experience and sensitivity when acquiring a new weapon.

The distinctive fighting system called Cross Action, which took the series a step forward in the right direction despite reducing the number of playable characters to two from six characters in the previous installments, but was replaced by creating a dynamic between common moves and skills and making them more exciting and influential than any previous installment, often reminded me of Astral Ad Chain and the way the characters interacted with each other during the fight, especially the R2 shooter called Cross Guard and the Cross Counter, which is a series of playable characters that is about a common stroke between the two characters.

There is a diversity in the gameplay, as well as the unchanging dialogue and choices of the story's plot. The combat system is very fast and each character excels in their own skills, making the gameplay and control of most of the characters very smooth and fun, and each character is characterized by its own role such as supporting the team or focusing on causing direct damage to enemies, which makes the action gameplay also strategic and profound. One of the most important aspects that action games require is how smooth the gameplay and the gameplay are. The gameplay and control of most of the characters are very smooth and fun, and each character has a mechanism and judgments that the characters share.

Rogue-lite missions, called Hollow Exploration, are free of any actual exploration, they are a two-dimensional puzzle containing boxes from which some treasures and coins are collected, some carrying enemies and requiring you to exit the maze which over time tends to repeat, especially as some are related to the main story making progress boring after hours of play.

The development of characters during the game helps to change and diversify the style of play, as the game progresses you will open up new Perks based on your level or the challenges you face, there are many Perks that offer many options that help diversify the style of play. The game offers a story style that can be played fully cooperatively by up to 4 players across the network, collaborative play is the essence of this game's reality, many fun moments that the player can share with the story's interlocutors.

The rhythm of the game becomes repetitive over time and almost halfway through the game you feel like you've seen everything the game has to offer you, the tasks become repetitive and the way it's presented is always the same, each task divided into four chapters always follows the same pattern in terms of how it's presented and the goals it's presented. Very limited weapons options, the game offers 3 types of weapons, main, secondary and gun. In each category only 3 or 4 weapons, with some additional weapons available but for a substantial $6.
